Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown-black (much worn); trace of painted rosette in added white outline; exterior reserved save for line at top of sherd and, on left, painted decoration consisting of part of wing of possible sphinx; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '94' is written in pencil on the exterior surface.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 21.1.44)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0968) (phase 2)
